biblStruct.note: Peter of Kallinikos’ Treatise against Damian is examined here as an important witness to the Syriac language and literature in the late sixth century, a period of increasing hellenization of Syriac literary culture. In order to determine the place of the Treatise in this ongoing process, a number of topics, dealing with lexicon, morphology, morpho-syntax, and idiomatic phraseology, will be singled out for study. A few provisional conclusions will bring this pilot study to a close.
